headline: Europe Has Pledged to Spend More on Defense. These Stocks Are Rising.
summary: Europe is going to spend more on national defense.  Leaders met this week at the annual summit of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, which includes 32 mostly European nations.  In 2024, Europe spent about €326 billion ($512 billion at current exchange rates) on defense.

headline: GDIT Awarded Task Order to Enhance Security and Readiness of U.S. Army Bases
summary: General Dynamics Information Technology (GDIT), a business unit of General Dynamics (NYSE: GD), announced today that it was awarded a $580 million Integrated Base Defense Sustainment Support task order to continue enhancing the security and readiness of U.S. Army bases. The task order, awarded in May, includes a one-year base period and four option years.

headline: Trump Demands More Missiles, Fewer F-35s As NATO Hikes Spending Targets
summary: President Trump's defense budget requests more missiles, drones, fewer F-35 jets, ships. NATO boosts defense spending targets.

raw.headline: Trump Demands More Missiles, Fewer F-35s As NATO Hikes Spending Targets

headline: North America Aviation Market Analysis 2025-2034 Featuring Strategic Profiles of Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, General Dynamics, Embraer and Other Industry Leaders
summary: The North America aviation market, valued at USD 80.98 Billion in 2024, is projected to reach USD 107.78 Billion by 2034, growing at a CAGR of 2.90%. Key growth drivers include advancements in aviation technology and increasing air travel demand.
